alert.note: Alert for Echols (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 11:41AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Suwannee, northwestern Hamilton and southwestern Echols Counties through 1230 PM EDT... At 1141 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Madison, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph, half inch hail, and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Jasper, Jennings, Statenville, Suwannee River State Park, Blue Springs and Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
